name: Divide operator
content:
Divides two numbers.

All programming languages support the basic arithmetic operations of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of numbers.

examples.name: Example: Divide Two Numbers

palette_params.description: The operands can be a number, or a variable containing a number, or the number returned by a function, or the numeric result of the evaluation of an expression.

return_value: A number, the result of division.
short_description: All programming languages support the basic arithmetic operations of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of numbers.
tips:
### Tips

- Operator precedence is the same as standard arithmetic
- Expressions within a parentheses have the highest precedence, then multiplcation and division, then addition and subtraction.
